Exceptional culinary insight.

Ability to work in a high volume environment
Chef in preparing exceptional meals
Motivated food serving professional with 5+ years food and beverage experience in casual and fine dining.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Andare Kitchen & Bar | Seasonal Full Time Food Runner ($19.97+/hour) 

Location: Seattle, WA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Organization- Hyatt Regency Seattle

Summary

Join us for an incredible opportunity to be a part of our Andare Kitchen & Bar as our Seasonal Full Time Food Runner at the Hyatt Regency Seattle!

Andare Kitchen & Bar delivers our guests a quick and efficient Italian-themed dining experience, while providing an environment that is upscale yet casual.

As an Andare Food Runner, you will be responsible primarily for assisting the Andare Server in serving the guest. Service includes any setup/breakdown of Andare buffets, clearing/cleaning tables, delivering food to the guests and any additional items they may need, and ensuring a positive and welcoming experience for the guest. This person must have good communication skills as well as the ability to lift, pull and push moderate weight. This is a fast paced position with continual customer contact.

 The hourly rate for this position is $19.97. This position also has an established rate for colleagues who remain in the position for four years, which is $20.37. Candidate must be available to work May through September. 

 This position earns additional compensation from gratuities and tips given at the guest’s discretion to the Andare serving team, as well as service charges on applicable orders. 

As a colleague, we have you covered with awesome benefits and perks!

Benefits

 401(k) & Retirement Savings Plan (RSP) Paid Time Off Compassionate Leave  Seattle Paid Sick & Safe Time

 Perks 

 Employee Assistance Program Free Uniforms and Cleaning of your Uniform Discounted parking Discounted Rooms at any participating Hyatt location starting on your first day of employment Free colleague meals during shift Hyatt Colleague discount program ORCA Pass subsidy

When applying for a position working at a Hyatt hotel, you are pursuing an opportunity to join a culture built on caring and attentive colleagues who have a passion for providing efficient service and creating meaningful experiences. Our values are the guiding principles for our success, giving us the opportunity to open over 1,350 properties worldwide.

 Hedreen Hotel Employer LLC is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, age, religion, disability, veteran status, genetic information, citizenship status, caste or any other group protected by law. 

Qualifications

 True desire to satisfy the needs of others in a fast paced environment  Refined verbal communication skills  Ability to be on your feet for long periods of time  Must have open availability including weekday, weekends, holidays, morning/afternoon/evenings  Previous restaurant experience or previous customer service experience preferred  MAST/Food Handler’s Cards required  Candidate must be available to work May through September.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
